===Etymology===
{{IPAchar|/seuki/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕeuki/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɕʲoːki/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しょうき}} compound {{m|zh|沼氣|tr=tsyew<sup>X</sup> khjɨj<sup>H</sup>|lit=pool, pond, swamp + vapors, gas}}. Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} reading ''ziu<sup>2</sup> hei<sup>3</sup>.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|しょうき|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しょうき|hhira=せうき}}

# [[marsh gas]], [[swamp gas]], [[methane]] {{qualifier|naturally occurring}}

====Usage notes====
Although one translation of this term is {{m|en|methane}}, this refers more specifically to the methane produced from organic matter rotting in a body of water. One would not generally use this term to refer to methane or natural gas as used for cooking or heating.
